required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Benefit of Enhanced Day Care of Traditional Chinese Medicine: A Retrospective Study of Medical Records
clinical_study.official_title: The Benefit of Enhanced Day Care of Traditional Chinese Medicine: A Retrospective Study of Medical Records

brief_summary.textblock: We collected medical records since June 2017 to November 2019., used pair-T test for questionnaire of CTCAE, BFT-I, WHOQOL to evaluate the benefit of enhanced day care of TCM for cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock: using TCM method as Complementary and Alternative Medicine is worldwide. we collected medical records that using TCM methods for adverse event from cancer therapies. we used CTCAE BFI-T and WHOQOF-BREF to evaluate the benefit.

primary_outcome.measure: scale of Taiwan brief version of Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version4.0(Taiwan brief version scale of CTCAE)
primary_outcome.description: for chemotherapy related adverse effects in Taiwan

secondary_outcome.measure: scale of the Taiwanese Version of the Brief Fatigue Inventory(BFI-T)
scale of the World Health Organization Quality of Life-BREF(WHOQOL-BREF)

intervention.intervention_name: enhanced day care of TCM include acupuncture, massage, tai ji quan, TCM herbal medicine
intervention.description: acupuncture twice in enhanced day care of TCM massage twice in enhanced day care of TCM tai ji quan one time in enhanced day care of TCM TCM herbal powder three times a day

study_pop.textblock: cancer patients who needed to accept surgery, or chemotherapy, or radiotherapy, or other conventional cancer therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The medical records since June 2017 to December 2019 needed to meet the following criterial: (1)age>20 years old, (2)diagnosis meet ICD10:C00.0-C97 (3) needed to do Taiwan brief version of Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version4.0(Taiwan brief version scale of CTCAE), scale of the Taiwanese Version of the Brief Fatigue Inventory(BFI-T) and scale of the World Health Organization Quality of Life-BREF(WHOQOL-BREF), and those scales needed to be done pretest when patient came to the clinics and posttest when case end.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subjects will be excluded if they do not complete pretest and posttest of the following scales:(1) Taiwan brief version scale of CTCAE, (2) BFI-T scale (3) WHOQOL-BREF scale
